ygData.subject: Re: Hand to Hand
ygData.msgSnippet: Monk punches are not faster at any given level than any other. What you are seeing here is the fact tht monks dual wield is generally higher than yours at any
ygData.messageBody:
Monk punches are not faster at any given level than any other. What you are
seeing here is the fact tht monks dual wield is generally higher than yours
at any given level. They get dualweld a level 1 after all so it is
perpetually maxxed. Probably wont see that much of a difference after level
24 or so when bards dual wield is maxed.. although monk DW goes to 225 last
I checked bard I think maxxes at 200 right?
Sr Smooth
----- Original Message -----
From: <kim@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, September 06, 1999 1:36 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Hand to Hand


> From: <kim@...>
>
> On Sat, 4 Sep 1999, Mike McGovern wrote:
> >
> > Well, another thing to consider is the delay on hands is
> > kinda slow, compared to a dirk or longsword. (30 delay is
> > what I've heard before.) So, less punches= less chances
>
> 35 delay. But it's been claimed that monk punches speed up as
> they gain levels. I've never seen any empirical evidence for
> it though.
>
> --
> John H. Kim
> kim@...
